title: What are the opportunities in EdTech? - Quora

response.answer_text: Right now edtech industry is somewhere huge opportunities lies. New ideas, new avenues, and investments are flooded to bring a change in the education scenario in the country. Before we discuss job opportunities in EdTech industry, we need to know major verticles : K-12 - These companies focused in KG to grade 12 school segment, Leading companies catering here are- Xseed education, ClassKlap, Chrysalis, Pearson, Funtoot etc Higher education - These companies are focused on college level or university level education, ex-Oxford university press, Cambridge university press etc. Test Prep - These companies are focused on online content delivery for competitive exam preparations. Few good players are OliveBoard, TopRankers, Career power, Etc. E-Learning - These companies target individual people or school/institute- they provide their content through the internet, Toppr, Byju's comes in this segment. Gaming - These companies have developed various educational games, this is growing vertical in edtech industry. StudyPad, Logic roots are some name which is working here. MOOC - It stands for Massive online open course companies, these companies provide various professional certification courses. UpGrad, Udemy, Coursera are some player in this segment. You check the following article if you are looking for job in edtech industry - Which is the best recruitment agency for EdTech Hiring in India? You have to decide in which segment you want to make your career, edtech industry is full of challenges. There are some consultancies also which is working only for edtech industry like Savanna HR, This recruitment firm is known because of their edtech hiring only. The increasing awareness among investors about a blended synergy of education and technology and their search for new investment alternatives have helped edtech platforms to surface prominently before investors. Edtech has become one of the hottest topics among investors and aspiring entrepreneurs lately. The country boasts more than 3500 edtech platforms and a total valuation of over $1 billion. Besides Byju’s other edtech startups like Bangalore based AttainU, an online platform offering courses to engineering and management graduates, have raised a considerable amount in angel funding. Overseas, the edtech investment was already over $9 billion in 2017. One year later, it reached a staggering $16.3 billion, with the next ten years projection showing a healthy 17% annual growth rate. Despite being one of the hottest buzzwords in the market, edtech still has a lot of room for innovation. The world is gearing up for the innovative fruits of edtech companies and the tremendous opportunities that come with them. After all, education is what shapes the future generations, and currently, there are no alternatives other than edtech initiatives that can provide quality education as well as serve as one of the best investment platforms for business.
